The Memorandum was discussed, and a number of amendmentsmade.The War Cabinet decided as follows : (1) The Foreign Secretary was invited to hand a copy of theMemorandum, as amended, to Mr. Winant. The textshould also be telegraphed to Lord Halifax, who shouldbe instructed to discuss the position with Mr. Winanton his arrival.(2) The Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs was invited togive the. Dominion Prime Ministers a resume of theposition, including the gist of the Memorandum to be handed to Mr. Winant.U.S.S.R. 2. Discussion followed on the general strategic position. Stalin an appreciation of British of the strategic position in the Middle East and in the Far East,strategic It was important that he should know to what extent our military position for strength in various areas would be affected by troop movements;M. Stalin. first, in order that he might not rely on a greater measure of help from us than he was likely to receive; secondly, in order that, at alater date, he might not say that, if he had been more fully informed of our position, he might have been able to afford us some measureof assistance.The War Cabinet-Invited the Chiefs of Staff to prepare an appreciation ofour military position in the Middle East and Far East, ina form suitable for communication to M. Stalin by thePrime Minister or the Foreign Secretary.Great George Street, S. W. 1,February 25, 1942.
